summary: Medicaid needs to ensure that its beneficiaries receive COVID-19 vaccines to prevent hospitalizations and deaths. But during the public health emergency, COVID-19 vaccines were provided to the public for free, and not by state Medicaid programs. Consequently, Medicaid didn't always know which of its beneficiaries had received the vaccines. We reviewed 6 state Medicaid programs and found that 4 of them got vaccination data on...
title: Medicaid: COVID-19 Vaccination Data Access and Strategies Used to Improve Immunization Rates
